Description: Launch an EC2 Operator to perform auto-start and auto-stop instances in the same region.

UtilSubnet.Description: subnet ID for instance to run

InstanceType.Description: Instance type for the EC2 Operator
InstanceType.ConstraintDescription: must be a valid EC2 instance type.

KeyName.Description: Name of an existing EC2 KeyPair to enable SSH access to the instance

Fn::Join:
#!/bin/bash -v
yum install -y python26-pip gcc
pip install croniter
OPERATOR=/home/ec2-user/ec2_operator.py
wget -O $OPERATOR https://raw.githubusercontent.com/uturndata/Public/master/ec2_operator.py
chown ec2-user:ec2-user $OPERATOR
chmod 644 $OPERATOR
echo "*/5 * * * * ec2-user python $OPERATOR > /home/ec2-user/ec2_operator.log 2>&1" >> /etc/crontab
pip install boto
SNAPSHOTCONFIG=/home/ec2-user/config.py
SNAPSHOT=/home/ec2-user/makesnapshots.py
wget -O $SNAPSHOTCONFIG https://raw.githubusercontent.com/uturndata/Public/master/config.py
wget -O $SNAPSHOT https://raw.githubusercontent.com/uturndata/Public/master/makesnapshots.py
chown ec2-user:ec2-user $SNAPSHOT
chmod 644 $SNAPSHOT
echo "30 1 * * 1-5 ec2-user python $SNAPSHOT day > /home/ec2-user/makesnapshots.log 2>&1" >> /etc/crontab
echo "30 2 * * 6 ec2-user python $SNAPSHOT week > /home/ec2-user/makesnapshots.log 2>&1" >> /etc/crontab
echo "30 3 1 * * ec2-user python $SNAPSHOT month > /home/ec2-user/makesnapshots.log 2>&1" >> /etc/crontab

OperatorInstanceId.Description: Instance Id of the ec2 operator instance
